JQuery

Click Event - Change Size

Click Me!

Selections are made in JQuery using $('.classname /or/ #id'). It is smart to store the selection in a variable so that each time your code needs to access that variable it doesn't have to look over your entire document to find it again.

Once our box is selected, we have box1.click(function(){}). This means to listen for a click on box 1, then execute that function. In this case, our function checks the box's current size. If it is 40px tall, it changes the height and width to a larger size. Otherwise (meaning it has already been changed) it changes the width and height back to their original values.

Click Event - User Input

Click Me!
Height Width

This builds on our last example, allowing the user to type a custom height and width into the input boxes, then when they click on the box, it will grow to that height/width. You will notice I also added in some restrictions for how large or small the height/width are allowed to go

JQuery Carousel

  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4
  • 5

Some explanations are included in the code. Basically, if the user clicks the previous button, it checks the current css 'left' value. if it's less than zero, we add 110, which takes us closer to 0. The left property goes negative in order to make the images slide right. Once it gets to 0, the image is all the way to the right.

On the other hand, when the user clicks 'next', we want to make the 'left' value smaller, so that the image will slide left. The lowest we want to go is -440, which is the left edge of the final picture. This way, we can't scroll past the first or last picture on either end.

Once we know the css value, and we've made sure that we aren't sliding past either end of the pictures, we can either add 110 or subtract 110 from the current css percentage in order to move the pictures in one direction or the other. The css property 'transition' has been set to 'transition: all 1s;' so that the images appear to slide. Of course, instead of the numbers 1-5, we could put images inside the divs and have a sliding carousel for pictures!
